intro: Antirrhinum siculum var. tortuosum, commonly known as the twisted-flowered snapdragon, is a rare and ornamental plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, curled, and twisted flower petals. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its unique floral morphology makes it a subject of interest in botanical studies and horticulture. It is often cultivated for its aesthetic value in gardens and botanical collections.
